dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Twenty-five million for Sofia Vergara, but still way behind Kaley Cuoco's seventy-three.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty-five million for Sofia Vergara, but still way behind Kaley Cuoco's seventy-three.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sofia Vergara Her giant haul, which clocks in at 73% more than second-ranked Kaley Cuoco's $24.5 million, leads this year's ranking of the small screen's top earners. The World's Highest-Paid Actresses 2018 1. Sofia Vergara Earnings: $42.5 million

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but that's the thing—Vergara's manager, Luis Balaguer, really emphasized their strategy to appeal beyond just Modern Family viewers. Her endorsements are a huge part of it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but that's the thing-Vergara's manager, Luis Balaguer, really emphasized their strategy to appeal beyond just Modern Family viewers. Her endorsements are a huge part of it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our attention is on the people watching Modern Family and how to appeal to them outside of the show, too, Luis Balaguer, Vergaras manager and business partner, told Forbes in 2016. Our endorsement department is a well-oiled machine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But Cuoco's pulling in almost a quarter of her earnings from deals like SharkNinja Coffee and Rooms To Go. That's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Cuoco's pulling in almost a quarter of her earnings from deals like SharkNinja Coffee and Rooms To Go. That's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Among them: coffee maker SharkNinja Coffee and furniture chain Rooms To Go. By contrast, 95% of Cuoco's earnings can be attributed to her role on Big Bang Theory.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And Vergara's only making five percent from Modern Family itself. The rest is all that endorsement machine they've built.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And Vergara's only making five percent from Modern Family itself. The rest is all that endorsement machine they've built.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Modern Family star reigns supreme thanks not only to her salary from her role on the hit ABC comedy but also to a slew of endorsements and lucrative licensing deals, which make up nearly half of her payday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, seventy-three million… I mean, even with Big Bang Theory struggling, she and the cast got a raise to 1.2 million per episode.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, seventy-three million... I mean, even with Big Bang Theory struggling, she and the cast got a raise to one point two million per episode.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Cuoco and her male co-stars took a pay cut, from an estimated $1 million an episode to $900,000 an episode, in an effort to free up cash for ranking newcomers Melissa Rauch (No. 6, $12 million) and Mayim Bialik (No. 6, $12 million).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but then you see Ellen Pompeo at twenty million—she negotiated backend and producer fees after Grey's Anatomy brought in billions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but then you see Ellen Pompeo at twenty million-she negotiated backend and producer fees after Grey's Anatomy brought in billions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Grey's Anatomy's Ellen Pompeo ($23.5 million) ranks third. Playing Meredith Grey for 15 seasons on Shonda Rhimes' Grey's Anatomy has allowed her to negotiate for a hefty upfront fee, a cut of the backend and a producer fee on spinoff Station 19.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Pompeo said something like, "maybe I do deserve a piece of this," which, honestly, fair point after twenty seasons.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pompeo said something like, maybe I do deserve a piece of this, which, honestly, fair point after twenty seasons.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Playing Meredith Grey for 15 seasons on Shonda Rhimes' Grey's Anatomy has allowed her to negotiate for a hefty upfront fee, a cut of the backend and a producer fee on spinoff Station 19.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And look at the newcomers this year—Mayim Bialik and Melissa Rauch only made it to seven and six million, and their pay got slashed for the final season.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And look at the newcomers this year-Mayim Bialik and Melissa Rauch only made it to seven and six million, and their pay got slashed for the final season.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rauch and Bialik are the only newcomers this year. Cast renegotiations saw their pay boosted to an estimated $500,000 an episode for the soon-to-conclude show.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Ouch. And three actresses dropped off entirely—Robin Wright, Mindy Kaling, Priyanka Chopra.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ouch. And three actresses dropped off entirely-Robin Wright, Mindy Kaling, Priyanka Chopra.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Three actresses dropped off the ranking: Robin Wright, Mindy Kaling and Priyanka Chopra.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Overall though, the top ten still pulled in over a hundred and fifty million combined. Not too shabby.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Overall though, the top ten still pulled in over a hundred and fifty million combined. Not too shabby.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Together, the world's 10 highest-paid TV actresses earned a combined $168.5 million between June 1, 2017, and June 1, 2018, up from $156.5 million in the same period last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, but it's down from last year. Maybe the era of huge TV paydays is slowing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but it's down from last year. Maybe the era of huge T V paydays is slowing?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Together, the world's 10 highest-paid TV actresses earned a combined $168.5 million between June 1, 2017, and June 1, 2018, up from $156.5 million in the same period last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Or maybe it's just shifting more toward endorsements and producing, like Vergara and Pompeo are doing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or maybe it's just shifting more toward endorsements and producing, like Vergara and Pompeo are doing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Good point. It's not just about the screen time anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good point. It's not just about the screen time anymore.

artist_script:
HostA: Twenty-five million for Sofia Vergara, but still way behind Kaley Cuoco's seventy-three.
HostB: Yeah, but that’s the thing—Vergara’s manager, Luis Balaguer, really emphasized their strategy to appeal beyond just Modern Family viewers. Her endorsements are a huge part of it.
HostA: But Cuoco’s pulling in almost a quarter of her earnings from deals like SharkNinja Coffee and Rooms To Go. That’s wild.
HostB: Exactly! And Vergara’s only making five percent from Modern Family itself. The rest is all that endorsement machine they’ve built.
HostA: Still, seventy-three million… I mean, even with Big Bang Theory struggling, she and the cast got a raise to 1.2 million per episode.
HostB: Right, but then you see Ellen Pompeo at twenty million—she negotiated backend and producer fees after Grey’s Anatomy brought in billions.
HostA: Pompeo said something like, “maybe I do deserve a piece of this,” which, honestly, fair point after twenty seasons.
HostB: And look at the newcomers this year—Mayim Bialik and Melissa Rauch only made it to seven and six million, and their pay got slashed for the final season.
HostA: Ouch. And three actresses dropped off entirely—Robin Wright, Mindy Kaling, Priyanka Chopra.
HostB: Overall though, the top ten still pulled in over a hundred and fifty million combined. Not too shabby.
HostA: True, but it’s down from last year. Maybe the era of huge TV paydays is slowing?
HostB: Or maybe it’s just shifting more toward endorsements and producing, like Vergara and Pompeo are doing.
HostA: Good point. It’s not just about the screen time anymore.
